storyInfo: A bizarre structure hangs in the sky above Trimounts, and everyone reacts to the sight of it in their own way. The most unforgettable night in Trimounts is about to unfold.

attributes.content: November 21st, 1099
7:11 P.M., H.A.M.H.R.R. Mission Elapsed Time 00:03:00
Brr... ugh...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Phooie, freezing around here. Asshats keep shutting off the heaters.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: How many complaints am I gonna have to file before they realize we're here at night on overtime?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Hey, honey, what are you calling for?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Hold on... I'll speak to you outside.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: What day is it today?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Um... nine days out from the project deadline. Progress is looking bad for us.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: I won't be home today either, no.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Our anniversary...? Oof.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Sorry, it's been crazy the past couple days... I know, honey, you've been looking forward to that restaurant forever... I know, I know, I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: The VP was touring Rhine Lab, so the egghead idiots on the Board have been going insane.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: They're forcing every project to produce interim results immediately, or else we're SOL.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: I'm not coming up with excuses, honey, it's just... Listen, I can't do today, I'll make it up to you some other time, I swear.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Hello? Honey, are you there?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: ...Shit.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: If only something would just... happen.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Why won't the offices blow up? Why won't goons rob a bank? Why don't Trimounts's stupid city treads just snap in half...
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Anything.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Night gradually sinks in. The office lights are set for another all-nighter, the shadow caging in this one pitiable researcher.
He gives a shiver. They say snow's coming in a few weeks. Someone bumps past him out of nowhere.
Okay, my fault for hoping.
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: Eventually, he shuffles his feet, stepping back into the high-rise. Just as he's stifled his urge to stay outside a little longer, an irritating droning noise emits from far off.
Catastrophe alarms, sounding with no warning. A PA demanding evacuation echoes through the streets. The researcher subconsciously leans to hurry his gait.
But suddenly, he notices everyone around him coming to a slow halt, all gazes drawn at once towards the sky.
With great skepticism, he lifts his head again.
—What the... hell is that?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: A massive toroid, in sluggish revolution, rises up from behind the building.
In the dark, as mechanical devices unfold, the neon of the city that glares off the upper surface becomes one with the structure, metal luster shining too brightly for the naked eye.
It is so imposingly majestic, so impossibly elegant, that it could only be the stuff of the most beautiful dreams ever dreamt. It pierces through the clouds. And inexplicably... it rises still.
Some kind of... ring?
attributes.name: Researcher

attributes.content: 7:13 P.M., H.A.M.H.R.R. mid-flight
I'm very interested, of course, extremely interested.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Really? Well, that's swell! If our project can get Rhine sponsorship...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Take a seat, ma'am. Anything to drink?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Uh... plain water will be fine, Justin, sir.
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Please, call me Justin Jr., even.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: How about some wine? War took the Gaulish Empire, but I thank the troops for leaving us the best vineyards intact.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Please.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I-If you insist. Thank you.
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Director, your office phone has been ringing non-stop.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: Tell them I'm busy.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You have... some friends of yours looking for you.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: Mayor Benjamin, Councilman Chris, Deputy Phil, Commander Colette. Who else?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: You have a Mr. Lewis. The one in charge of industrial sec.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: They say—Who might you be, ma'am?
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: Ah, sorry! I'll wait outside!
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Don't worry about it, no secrets here.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Er, right.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: They appear to be extremely unhappy with the articles you deposited at Plate Seven. They were under the impression the project was a more—'ordinary' one.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: Commander Colette went to Mr. Lewis. I'm afraid all Plate Seven monitoring files will be lost by tomorrow.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: The Mayor and Councilman have returned every case we've sent them over the past few years, and declared they'll no longer be seeking your aid for campaigns.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: The Deputy made some very... radical statements. I hear he's gotten an emergency arrest warrant for the state prosecutor, and seems to be on the way here now.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: I've notified Defense, but we can't keep them away for long.
attributes.name: Business Clerk

attributes.content: And here I swore we got along well enough.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: *sigh* How fragile a friendship is. Wouldn't you say, ma'am?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Justin, sir, I-I'm only here to ask you to invest, I don't think I should necessarily be in the loop on all this...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Aren't you curious, though? What could Rhine Lab have that scares these elites, and bureaucrats, and black suits in white gloves, so badly that they'd crawl out of bed in the middle of the night to get to work?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I... I don't know. A-A nanodroid that extends your lifespan forever... or something?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Nice idea. If someone came to me with a prospectus and technical prototype, you know I'd invest.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Ha... haha...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Um, I am wondering a little—
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: —why you'd call me up, of all people...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Have you ever heard of Stade syndrome, ma'am?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Huh? I-I've seen it in the files. A rare hereditary condition, I think?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Very rare, highly fatal, and extremely stubborn. Sufferers of it aren't usually expected to live beyond forty-five, and more than likely pass it on to their children.
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: I assume it was Rhine Lab that developed—
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Look, no rush to win your potential sponsor over.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: But, yes, fairytale ending, there's a miracle cure out for Stade syndrome, and while Rhine Lab had no involvement in the research, it goes without saying that many have reaped the benefits.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Pity it arrived a little late, is all. Old Justin Sr. died of organ failure from Stade syndrome three days before they finalized the drug.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Justin Sr.? He must be...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Sure was. And his son, Justin Jr., was informed out of the big wide blue, after struggling in fear for a decade and change, that he could live like a normal human thanks to the med.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Bam. The nightmare that plagued my family was gone. Like it never even existed.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Only later did I learn that the key element in the drug popped up when an intern researcher happened to mess up some reagents.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: That's fate. Hah, that's how it goes.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I... um, well, at least you're free of the disease now.
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Because of a random, dumb mistake?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: The incapable might call it 'a twist of fate' and when the curtains are closed, pat themselves on the back for it, even.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: They see it as a gift of chance.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: But I—
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I can't stand it. I won't stand for it.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I'll have this phenomenon safe and secure in my own hands. I'll grip it. I'll control it.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I'll dictate to it where it goes.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: A Catastrophe alarm? Why does it have to be now...?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Justin, sir, we need to evacuate!
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Ha, finally.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Justin Fitzroy Jr.
Well, if it isn't the Supreme Court, you've finally got me.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: What is your pledge?
I pledge it will lead Columbia forth.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: What guarantees that?
Is my participation not enough?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Your many 'friends' are dissuading me at this very moment.
They tell me Columbian law shouldn't allow your people continue in their unbridled ways.
If a mere fondness for sending out cases of money does unbridled ways make, then what, pray tell, do Kristen's actions sum to?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Justice, you told me that it's not for the protection of any sanctimonious 'ethics' that Columbian law works.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: It must hew the brambles, for those who make forth.
I ask, then. What is your verdict?
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: If Columbia's court pales timid and weak, then I should see no reason why it deserves my further tenure.
Much obliged.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Was that just a... a Supre—Supreme Court Justice calling?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: What... research are you... are Rhine Lab even handling?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Easy, easy. Rhine Lab's no danger to the law. You're with a trustworthy firm.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Ah, well, back on topic. About what I've been stashing in the jurisdictional care of my 'friends.'
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Go pull the curtains, ma'am. You won't want to miss the show tonight.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: What is... that?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: How is something that big... flying?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Is that... another Rhine Lab project?
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: I'll be honest, you're not really a qualified entrepreneur. You're a flip-flopper. Scare easy. Not confident enough, always second-guessing. Got a habit of spending too much time on how you word things.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: To be frank, it's no wonder Trimountian investor circles don't like you.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Lucky for you, none of that matters to me.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Rhine Lab will buy out your power laboratory in whole, I'll provide you ample funds, and it will be seen to that all is done to support your research endeavors to come.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: If Lady Luck is on our side, and one day you rise to directorship at Rhine Lab, then it's not out of the question that you might get a little section carved out for you.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Just as our young Dr. Franks got.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: That's... I don't understand, so much has happened today...
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Just say yes. Because luck doesn't claim the credit here, for it has been my decision.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: Where the hand of Justin Jr. reaches, there is random chance no longer, ma'am.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: I help the lunatic to succeed.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: ...I understand, Director Justin.
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: Looking forward to working with you.
attributes.name: Nervous Entrepreneur

attributes.content: And welcome to the Rhine Lab family. Cheers.
attributes.name: Justin Jr.

attributes.content: 7:25 P.M., H.A.M.H.R.R. mid-flight
Seems we've finally found it, Colonel.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Bitch of a process, eh?
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: We weren't anticipating Kristen would have another propulsion unit ready to go for H.A.M.H.R.R.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: She hid the whole contraption under a garbage heap, and now she's sailed the damn thing through Trimounts airspace like she owns it.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: This is all my fault.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: No point in talking the blame now, Colonel.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Things are all headed for the worst-case.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: H.A.M.H.R.R. is still flying for S.H.A.F.T., bound for its upper surface with an ETA of twenty minutes.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Based on what the manuals say, it'll be hovering within about five klicks of the S.H.A.F.T., which gives it maximal odds of taking down any ground targets in its angle of drift.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: But of course, 'Arc-01' is in no suitable position to launch attacks or counter enemy positions right now. Our plans never extended beyond demonstrated feasibility within Trimounts.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Five klicks of altitude is something the average aerial unit just can't do. Your considerations were all-comprehensive outside of that blindsiding.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: We're dispatching specialist drones from the District capable of higher altitudes, but we still need more time.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Meanwhile, we have every regular drone allocated to Trimounts already on liftoff. They'll interfere with H.A.M.H.R.R.'s continued ascent as best they can.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Effects look to be limited.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Seems the military gave this ring thing some sturdy armor. I thought these Maylander drones were advanced for Columbia as is.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Outstanding work. Medals for all the generals, I say.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: The DOD has a hell of a lot resting on this.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: ...'No point in talking the blame now,' sir.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: What's important is we get the situation back into your hands.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Into 'our' hands, Colonel. Personally, I understand the pitch the army is making. Ever since the Bolívar debacle, your people have been mighty eager to get back on the stage.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: But we're all Columbians, aren't we?
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Goes with saying, when I enlisted, I pledged my loyalty to Columbia.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Kristen still won't contact us, and won't respond to any hails from us either.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: These aren't the actions of an opportunist or kidnapper, but if this is a bluff by the military, we can't say anything for sure.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: All we can be thankful for is—no matter what she intends to do, the S.H.A.F.T. is under our control and always has been. She has no way to...
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Sorry, Mr. Vice President, let me proceed.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Colonel, it seems your people have some urgent news for you.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: It's me. I'm with the Vice President right...
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: ...Charging?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Haven't we been in total control of the S.H.A.F.T. this whole time? How could it... Shut the whole S.H.A.F.T. down immediately!
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: You can't? What do you mean you can't? How hard can it be to find the goddamned switch or breaker or whatever it is and flip it?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Pull out the wires! Kill the power source! Do whatever it takes, I don't care what facilities we damage!
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: You're telling me, you've done everything you can, and the S.H.A.F.T. has not only failed to shut down, its goddamned energy readings are still climbing?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Bring every ounce of explosive we have in Trimounts. Blow that thing to kingdom come.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: It's already charged, and if you blow it up, the energy dissipation will level the entire city, Colonel. That's what Maylander's agents are telling me.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: You've got a crafty one on your hands, hah.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: She's out of her goddamned mind! How much does she hate Columbia?! What is she up to?!
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Hold on... I can think of one possibility.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: —The District.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: It's the District. If H.A.M.H.R.R.'s angle deviates far enough, it's probably gonna threaten Max D.C.!
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Our beloved President is still situated there. Kristen... she intends to destroy the heart and the brain of Columbia.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: We have to evacuate all personnel in the District immediately.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Don't worry, Colonel. The President's just told me we're fine.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Armed forces in the District are mobilized, and General Barry is taking charge of the defense there. She's promised me she'll protect the President with her life.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: ...General Barry?
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Oh, I guess you didn't hear. She's just been promoted.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Carry on with your mission, Colonel. Columbia still needs you in this dire hour.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: Anything else?
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: No, nothing.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: I swear, I'm gonna put an end to this insanity, personally.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Don't overwork yourself.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: ...If you'll excuse me.
attributes.name: Blake

attributes.content: Will these orders do, Mr. President?
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: I'll be honest, I'm not entirely sure about this. Still, I won't question your judgment—
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: I understand. I'll head out at once.
attributes.name: Jackson

attributes.content: You see that? What is it?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: Is that what the brass is after?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: Sure is a high-flying bastard...
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: Where's it heading?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: ...Out of the city.
By appearances, an energy accumulation device.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Out of the city? The S.H.A.F.T.?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: What did the Colonel call those things? 'Arc-01?' H.A.M.H.R.R.?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: What the hell is that mad scientist thinking?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: What the hell is that mad scientist thinking?
Idealism. Obsession. Curiosity. Initiative.
It's a trend that scientists are tied to these qualities.
Silence will admit, as a scientist herself, as a former Rhine Lab employee, that when she first caught that tremendous megastructure rising to the sky, she felt a faint tug on her heartstrings.
And a mortifying sense of pride.
This company she once struggled for was creating—no—had created a wonder of the land... of the sky. She should by all rights bask in it... shouldn't she?
Deception. Calculation. Sacrifice. Conspiracy.
She quickly comes to, realizing what this marvel was built upon.
Control. Kristen Wright...
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: As an ordinary researcher, she never had too much contact with Kristen. Perhaps, at most, a glimpse or two of the Rhine Lab Control during wrap-up conferences at the end of the year.
She still remembers the look in Kristen's eyes.
In her eyes, there was only one thing.
Scientists must think about one thing, and one thing only... 'And that is how to accomplish it.'
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: A scientist's sole responsibility is to push science to progress. 'That alone is more than enough to exhaust us.'
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: ...And where is it that progress lies?
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Whenever Columbia's wastes see rain, the vegetation quickly turns to overgrowth. When people hand down decisions from high perches, dictating what plants are of use and what should be disparaged as weeds, it never sits well with me.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: We need to admit, no matter what, that that should not be described as 'progress.'
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Kristen, and those like her, and those who wear the same guise as her...
They all lay claim to their vision, their direction, as the way that science's progress should orient.
She wouldn't dare say she understands the secretive, elusive Control, but she understands the rest of them, and the respective... costs of their journeys forward.
Who will define progress? Who will watch over it... Hasn't it seen too many sacrifices beneath its heels?
Science must progress, of course.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: I am a researcher myself. I sympathize as such.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: But we must be aware—of the nature of the costs therein.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: We must be aware—
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: —that science does not solely serve personal ideals nor obsessions.
attributes.name: Silence

attributes.content: Is that a drone?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: Researcher. What are you doing?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: I don't want trouble with you, and the guys in charge don't need your help anymore, so you ought to—
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: Hey! We're talking to you!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: The hell is she up to?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: The key! Your car key!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: She stole one of our cars? Is she insane?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: Shit, we need to—
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: Silence! Silence!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Where'd the girl come from? This is a military exclusion zone!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: The hell are you doing?!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier A

attributes.content: Move it!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Ugh!
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: Gimme your car key too!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Uh, do—do you know how to drive, young lady?
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: Maybe you need me to—
attributes.name: Columbian Soldier B

attributes.content: Shut up! I've got this under control!
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: ...Uh, but just to confirm, left one is the brake, right?
attributes.name: Ifrit
